data.title: Rabbis from Frankfurt
data.text:
Overview: Samson Raphael Hirsch (Hebrew: שמשון רפאל הירש‎; June 20, 1808 – December 31, 1888) was a German Orthodox rabbi best known as the intellectual founder of the Torah im Derech Eretz school of cont ...

Date of birth: 20 June 1808

Date of death: 31 December 1888

Age: 80 (age at death)

Nationality: German

Occupation: Religion

Gender: Male

Overview: Isaac Heinemann (Hebrew: יצחק היינמן) (born 5 June 1876; died 28 July 1957) was Israeli rabbinical scholar and a professor of classical literature, Hellenistic literature and philology.

Date of birth: 5 June 1876

Date of death: 28 July 1957

Age: 81 (age at death)

Nationality: Israeli

Occupation: Educator

Gender: Male

Overview: Dayan Chanoch Ehrentreu (27 December 1932 in Frankfurt-am-Main – 24 November 2022 in London) served for many years as the head of the London Beth Din in Great Britain (also known as The Court of the Chief ...

Date of birth: 1932

Date of death: 24 November 2022

Age: 90 (age at death)

Nationality: German

Overview: Shabtai Horowitz (Hebrew: שבתי הורוויץ; c. 1590 – 12 April 1660) was a rabbi and talmudist, probably born in Ostroh, Volhynia. He was the son of the kabbalist Isaiah Horowitz, and at an early age married ...

Date of birth: 1590

Date of death: 1660

Age: 69 (age at death)

Nationality: Czech

Overview: Jacob Joshua Falk (Hebrew: יעקב יהושע פלק, also Yaakov Yehoshua ben Tzvi Hirsch, or Yaakov Yehoshua Falk — see Note on the name "Joshua Falk") 1680 – January 16, 1756) was a Polish and German rabbi and ...

Date of birth: 1680

Date of death: 1756

Age: 75 (age at death)

Nationality: Polish

Overview: Abraham Geiger (Hebrew: אַבְרָהָם גִייגְר ʼAvrāhām Gīgər; 24 May 1810 – 23 October 1874) was a German rabbi and scholar, considered the founding father of Reform Judaism. Emphasizing Judaism's c ...

Date of birth: 24 May 1810

Date of death: 23 October 1874

Age: 64 (age at death)

Nationality: German

Occupation: Historian

Gender: Male

Overview: Joseph Breuer (1882–1980) was a rabbi and community leader in Germany and the United States. He was a Rabbi of one of the large Jewish synagogues founded by German-Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi oppression ...

Date of birth: 1882

Date of death: 1980

Age: 97 (age at death)

Nationality: Hungarian

Overview: Moses Schreiber (1762–1839), known to his own community and Jewish posterity in the Hebrew translation as Moshe Sofer, also known by his main work Chatam Sofer, Chasam Sofer or Hatam Sofer, (trans. Seal ...

Date of birth: 26 September 1762

Date of death: 3 October 1839

Age: 77 (age at death)

Overview: Rabbi Benzion Rakow, (1925-1985), was a communal rabbi and rosh yeshiva of Chayei Olam Yeshiva in Golders Green, London. He was also active in Agudas Yisroel of Great Britain.

Date of birth: 1925

Date of death: 1985

Age: 59 (age at death)

Nationality: British

Overview: Rabbi Mechel Scheuer was born in Frankfurt am Main in 1739 to his father Rabbi David Tebele Scheuer. He led his father's Yeshiva in Mainz as its Rosh Yeshiva during the years 1776 and 1777.

Date of birth: 1739

Date of death: 1810

Age: 70 (age at death)

Overview: Shmuel Schotten HaCohen (1644 – 5 July 1719), known as the Mharsheishoch, became Rabbi of the Grand Duchy of Hesse-Darmstadt in west Germany in 1685.

Date of birth: 1644

Date of death: 1719

Age: 74 (age at death)

Occupation: Writer

Overview: Alexander Suslin HaKohen (died 1349) was a prominent 14th century rabbinic authority born in Erfurt, Germany, and one of the most important Talmudists of his time. He was rabbi first in Cologne and Worms ...

Date of death: 1349

Occupation: Writer
